reviews.snippet: Not worth it. It was very disappointing. We ordered Wagyu bowl in medium rare and Wagyu Cheese Burger. The Wagyu is not soft and not much for the amount of money they are charging. It was a small bowl with most of it are rice, very few slices of meat on top. Don’t get me wrong, I don’t mind paying for good food at all, but their food is very disappointing. Most of their costumers are foreigners and probably like everyone else there, we also saw this place on social media from some influencers, plus the reviews are great so my family though we have to try it, but this one is more like a tourist trap restaurant. I’d rather go to Yakiniku that serves great cut meat including wagyu than go back to this restaurant. The server actually ask us to leave a review so here is my honest review.

I’d rather go to Yakiniku that serves great cut meat including wagyu than go back to this restaurant. The server actually ask us to leave a review so here is my honest review.

reviews.snippet:
Ein sehr schönes kleines Restaurant, welches sich auf Wagyu Gerichte spezialisiert hat.
Es hat nicht viel Auswahl aufgrund seiner Spezialisierung, daher sollte man wissen, dass man hier nur Gerichte mit Wagyu bekommt.
Die Gerichte sind höherpreisiger (zwischen 6.000-32.000 je nach Essen und Kombo, die man auswählt), dafür bekommt man jedoch free refills (keinen Alkohol, weil ein Halal Restaurant) und das Essen ist wirklich sehr gut. Man merkt, dass sie sich auf das Zubereiten von Wagyu spezialisiert haben und während es kein Restaurant zum „mal so“ Essen ist, ist es ein Erlebnis wert.
Man sollte nicht mit zu vielen Leuten, max. 4 Personen hingehen, da es sonst aufgrund der geringen Platzanzahl schwer werden kann.
Ich kann es nur empfehlen, dieses Erlebnis mal gemacht zu haben.

extracted_snippet.original:

Die Gerichte sind höherpreisiger (zwischen 6.000-32.000 je nach Essen und Kombo, die man auswählt), dafür bekommt man jedoch free refills (keinen Alkohol, weil ein Halal Restaurant) und das Essen ist wirklich sehr gut. extracted_snippet.translated:
A very nice little restaurant specializing in Wagyu dishes.
Due to their specialization, there isn't much choice, so be aware that they only serve Wagyu dishes.
The dishes are more expensive (between 6,000 and 32,000 depending on the meal and combo you choose), but you get free refills (no alcohol, as it's a halal restaurant), and the food is really very good. You can tell they specialize in preparing Wagyu, and while it's not a casual dining restaurant, it's worth the experience.
Don't go with too many people—maximum 4 people—otherwise it might be difficult due to the limited seating.
I highly recommend trying this experience.

details.dietary_restrictions: Dieses Restaurant hat, bis auf normalen Reis, keine vegetarischen Gerichte, da alle Gerichte mit Wagyu Fleisch sind.
details.wheelchair_accessibility: Da es mit einem Fahrstuhl herunter geht, kommt man mit einem Rollstuhl ebenfalls dorthin

translated_details.dietary_restrictions: This restaurant has no vegetarian options except for regular rice, as all dishes are made with Wagyu meat.
translated_details.wheelchair_accessibility: Since there is an elevator down, you can also get there with a wheelchair

reviews.snippet:
Very bad experience, I can make a better burger at home! Also very unhygienic place, they don’t use gloves while handling food and my friend had a worm in his salad!
Never again! And I come from Dubai where we have a food paradise and it’s much better there. Very expensive for what you get , value to portion is extortionate!
Go to another place instead!

Also you have to stick around for the complimentary dessert.
